snippet: Ukraine’s cabinet voted to stop trade with Crimea beginning in mid-January, and Russia signed a decree excluding Ukraine from a trade bloc of former Soviet states on Jan. 1.
abstract: Ukraine decides to end trade with Crimea starting in mid-January, and Russia plans to exclude Ukraine from free trade bloc of former Soviet states beginning Jan 1, 2016.
lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s cabinet voted to stop trade with Crimea beginning in mid-January, and Russia signed a decree excluding Ukraine from a trade bloc of former Soviet states on Jan. 1.

headline.print_headline: Europe; Ukraine and Russia Curb Trade Ties
headline.main: Trade War Escalates Between Russia and Ukraine
